item.title: Problem 230 Kth Smallest Element in a BST
item.description: Problem Statement Link - Problem 230 Question Given the root of a binary search tree, and an integer k, return the kth smallest value (1-indexed) of all the values of the nodes in the tree. Example 1 Input: root = [3,1,4,null,2], k = 1 Output: 1 Example 2 Input: root = [5,3,6,2,4,null,null,1], k = 3 Output: 3 Constraints - The number of nodes in the tree is `n`. - `1 <= k <= n <= 10^4` - `0 <= Node.
